intro: Matayba apetala f. genuina, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and red or orange berries. The plant is typically evergreen, with glossy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular plant in horticulture, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
